info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 12:27PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is expected as a result of prolonged rainfall. * WHERE...In northeast Georgia, portions of Rabun County. In western North Carolina, portions of Macon County. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. The Nantahala River likely is flooding low-water crossings at Tate Cove Rd and near Water Gauge Rd and Rainbow Springs Rd, and is beginning to strand residents or require lengthy detours into Clay County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1227 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated rain due to persistent light rain showers. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Nantahala River near Rainbow Springs. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen, with additional showers expected this afternoon. - The Nantahala River near Rainbow Springs is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mountain City, Dillard, Sky Valley, Black Rock Mountain State Park, Otto, Scaly Mountain, Rainbow Springs and Pine Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
